image.altText: Two corflute signs side-by-side on the ground, showing the faces of NT politicians Eva Lawler and Lia Finocchiaro.

props.synopsis: Faced with rising crime and cost-of-living pressures, the major parties have made some bold commitments ahead of the NT election. With early voting opening on Monday, here's what voters have been promised.

title.children: With early voting to open tomorrow, here's what the major parties have promised Territorians this election

image.altText: Sinead Diver leads the pack of runners

props.synopsis: The 2024 Olympic Games are almost over, featuring the women's marathon, Australia's women's basketballers going for bronze, while the cycling team wraps up its program at the velodrome on a busy final day in Paris. Follow live.

title.children: Aussie Sinead Diver out injured after a kilometre of women's marathon to kick off final day of Paris Olympics

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Athletics: Sinead Diver is in agony and looks done just four minutes into the marathon

image.altText: An old photo of Marilyn taking a photo of her daughter, who is next to her husband, outside a church.

props.synopsis: Audra Keeble remembers the "touchy feely" photographer's assistant at her wedding who kept adjusting her veil and dress. It was a piece of a puzzle she wouldn't solve until years later, as she uncovered the truth about her life.

title.children: A fake photographer's assistant snuck into this woman's wedding. She only found out who it was years later

image.altText: A close-up shot of an older man with a long white beard.

props.synopsis: He's famous for roles in some of Australia's finest movies, from Breaker Morant to Wake in Fright. But it was the year he spent in the territory outback as a teenager that Jack Thompson says had an impact that has "lasted me my life".

title.children: Actor Jack Thompson reflects on his teenage outback 'adventure that lasted me my life'

image.altText: A large white sign showing a coat of arms and the words "local court".

props.synopsis: An inquest into the fatal overdose of a Darwin nurse has handed down its findings, with the NT coroner finding "an offence may have been committed".

title.children: Coroner refers 'suspicious death' of Darwin nurse to DPP for further investigation

image.altText: Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris

props.synopsis: A well-funded lobby group has been spending millions on US election races to punish Democrats who don't toe the line on Israel.

title.children: The pro-Israel lobby came for 'the Squad' — and sent a message to Kamala Harris

image.altText: ASIO spy chief Mike Burgess

props.synopsis: Australia's domestic spy chief has warned people would be shocked to learn the identity of the countries his agency has caught actively interfering in diaspora communities.

title.children: 'Three to four' friendly nations among the countries interfering in Australian communities

image.altText: DSC06537 copy

props.synopsis: For most of his life, rock star Nick Cave says he was "in awe of his own genius". Cataclysmic life events fundamentally "re-arranged" him.

title.children: 'I wasn't remotely in showroom condition': Nick Cave says Kylie Minogue was brave to step into his world

image.altText: A sillouette of a destroyed building with children in the foreground

props.synopsis: More than 80 Palestinians are dead and dozens injured after an Israeli air strike on a school sheltering displaced people east of Gaza City, according to Palestinian authorities.

title.children: UN human rights office condemns Israeli airstrike that hit east Gaza school sheltering displaced Palestinians

image.altText: Charlie Curnow in pain after injuring his ankle

props.synopsis: Carlton is sweating on the result of scans on Charlie Curnow's ankle after he was one of four players injured in Sunday's loss to Hawthorn. Meanwhile, Adelaide has gotten off to a hot start against the Western Bulldogs. Follow live.

title.children: Curnow injury compounds Blues nightmare, as Crows stun Dogs in opening term

image.altText: A man runs the ball during a rugby league match

props.synopsis: Newcastle will be looking to keep touch with the top eight when they take on the Wests Tigers. Follow live.

title.children: Knights fight to keep finals hopes alive as Tigers try to escape wooden spoon

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Match report: O'Sullivan lands monster field goal as Phins pip Warriors
SEAN O'SULLIVAN WINS THE GAME FOR THE DOLPHINS!
Dolphins and Warriors head to golden point!

image.altText: Two boys lug sacks of rice on their shoulders.

props.synopsis: For more than two months, the only way to get food, medicine and other supplies into Porgera has been to carry them by foot over a huge cascade of rocks left by a landslide.

title.children: Kids isolated by a fatal PNG landslide are going to bed hungry and many have dropped out of school

image.altText: GettyImages-2166225862

props.synopsis: Jessica Hull has come on in leaps and bounds over the past 12 months, going from an also-ran at major championships to being an Olympic silver medallist.

title.children: Jess Hull's meteoric rise to a Paris Olympics silver is the result of unwavering determination and endurance

image.altText: qhits34

props.synopsis: Jordan Chiles looks likely to have her bronze taken from her, a Kiwi high jumper explains why he wasn't keen on sharing gold, and a Aussie weightlifter gets so close to Olympic glory.

title.children: Olympic quick hits: American gymnast set to lose her bronze, Kiwi refuses to share high jump gold, and heartache for Aussie weightlifter

image.altText: Noah Lyles slumps while being spoken to by medical staff

props.synopsis: COVID was not supposed to play a major role in the Olympics anymore — but Paris 2024 has shown that for the athletes, it's still an issue.

title.children: The COVID Games — how the silent virus created a commotion that echoed around Paris

image.altText: Two men in suits stand in front of the Australian flag, with one speaking and the other looking at him

props.synopsis: ASIO told the newly elected Albanese government in mid-2022 to lower Australia's national terror alert level to "possible", but Labor stalled on the advice for almost half a year before enacting it.

title.children: Labor stalled for months on lowering terror alert level after ASIO recommendation in 2022

image.altText: Two men stand on stage together

props.synopsis: The campaign of the Republican US presidential candidate made the statement, without direct evidence, citing previous tensions between the former US president and Iran.

title.children: Donald Trump’s campaign says its emails were hacked by Iran

image.altText: The green-blue aurora borealis seen in the night sky over a large hill/mountain

props.synopsis: Do you feel at peace under the stars? That effect is supported by research, which links our connectedness to the night sky to general wellbeing.

title.children: Want to boost your mental health? Step outside and look up at the night sky

image.altText: A dark aerial photo showing a group of people among debris from a blown-apart plane.

props.synopsis: Brazilian rescue teams have retrieved the remains of all 62 victims from the wreckage of a plane crash in São Paulo state.

title.children: 'Hits all of us': Remains of all 62 Brazil plane crash victims retrieved from wreckage

image.altText: an aboriginal woman wearing a blue collared shirt in front of bushland

props.synopsis: Leanne Liddle says her work will not be just "ink on a paper", but tangible efforts to improve recruitment processes and weed out systems that exclude Indigenous people.

title.children: The woman tasked with combating NT police racism says 'tangible outcomes' to follow Garma apology

image.altText: A burning building

props.synopsis: Russia is fighting intense battles against thousands of Ukrainian troops as deep as 20 kilometres inside the Kursk region after Ukraine's biggest attack on Russian sovereign territory since the start of the war.

title.children: Russia evacuates more than 76,000 people in Kursk region, Zelenskyy vows to 'restore justice'

image.altText: A man standing behind a building.

props.synopsis: Manufacturing once played a critical role in the Australian economy but now makes up less than 6 per cent of the nation's GDP. So why is the government trying to revive it now?

title.children: Almost two decades ago, Peter was made redundant at Holden. Now the government wants a future made in Australia

image.altText: Police officer and woman in space-age costume leaning on police car in 1980s

props.synopsis: In the era of smoke machines, chart-topping pop music, and choker necklaces, Queensland's blue light discos were the place to be. But will they ever appeal to gen Zs and alphas?

title.children: A few slow dances and maybe a peck on the cheek': Gen Z and gen alpha targeted in blue light disco revival

image.altText: a gorup of people dressed as cows raise their fists and cheer at the end of the city2surf fun run in bondi

props.synopsis: An estimated 90,000 participants hit the ground running for the annual City2Surf fun run, including a group of firefighters wearing about 20kgs of gear and equipment for a good cause.

title.children: Family runs in honour of 3yo Sophie, as more than $3 million raised for charities at City2Surf

image.altText: People hold up signs saying 'hope not fear' and 'hope not hate'

props.synopsis: The king's message comes as thousands of anti-racism demonstrators protest against the violent riots, and police arrest hundreds.

title.children: King Charles calls for mutual respect and understanding after Britain's racist riots

image.altText: A woman gestures in anger while driving

props.synopsis: The evolution of swear words proves how flexible and adaptable they are. But where there do they originate? Our social taboos hold the answer.

title.children: 'Gadzooks', 'sneeze' and 'damn' were once swear words. So what changed?

image.altText: A composite image of Nina Kerridge, a boy jumping with a ball and lots of people squished together dressed in blue.

props.synopsis: From the loudest burp to reciting the alphabet backwards in the least time … it might be unorthodox but you just may have what it takes to be a world champion.

title.children: Got Olympic fever but no sporting ability? A Victorian couple helps everyday Aussies break bizarre records

image.altText: Several kids playing in the water with a background of stilted houses

props.synopsis: Malaysia's government controversially evicted hundreds of sea nomads, known as Bajau Laut, from their homes in June. Human rights advocates warn more of the stateless population could be targeted.

title.children: The real-life inspiration for an Avatar film have their ancestral homes burned and demolished

image.altText: A compilation image of four local government buildings on sunny days

props.synopsis: Latest data show Walgett Shire and Northern Beaches councils among the top five where ratepayers spent the most on general managers.

title.children: The NSW councils where general managers get paid more than premier

image.altText: A painting of two pelicans appears to show them dining on fish from a takeaway store's sign.

props.synopsis: The phrase "urban jungle" takes on a new meaning in London as murals by the enigmatic street artist Banksy spring up across town. But fans are yet to decode their meaning.

title.children: London's week of Banksy murals leaves fans scratching their heads

image.altText: Slow cooked lamb, on a plate with roasted pumpkin and beetroot

props.synopsis: Chef Matt Moran's slow-roasted lamb shoulder features plenty of colourful veggie sides and a refreshing mint salsa.

title.children: A flavourful slow-roasted lamb shoulder to take your time over
